title: The Problem with SoloKaiser
body:
After 30+ games with the reworked Mordekaiser top I've come to realize why he sucks so hard up there.
It's simple; HE CAN'T PLAY DEFENSIVE
If you're opponent's ranged or gets ahead there's nothing you can do play safe.
You can't go in for cs because your shieldgain's pretty bad if not ahead, his nerfed siphon making things really, really hard. You can't throw a W onto your minion, gain shield and go in to secure some cs with your E anymore. No, you're royally fucked!
You can't do shit. Really. Even if you go in and try to lasthit some minions you're dead as soon as you're cced because of your shitty MS and the fact that you won't be getting any shield if behind.

Riot, Give Mordekaiser his W back so that he can actually SURVIVE difficult matchups and lost lanes instead of practically being forced to get even more behind due to not being able to CS or chainfeed the enemy!
FIX
THIS
RIOT

//RANT//

replies.body: only ppl who never played morde before rework defend this new morde...

That's assuming there was anything to defend about the old Morde.

Not saying the rework is good, it needs a lot of tweaks to be good.

But in all honesty, his new problems are the same as his old problems.

You either out shoved your lane opponent and won via CS or you were worthless except for flash, ulting the ADC late game after your team has done most of the work.
The only good thing about the old Morde was that he was nigh ungankable except by top tier early game junglers in conjunction with top tier early game laners.  
He was a mid-range, damage oriented mage which fits almost no needed niche in the game and really just served to be a wave pusher while his team worried about poke, CC and team fights.
He was fun as F*^K to play, but to say he was good or healthy is more than a stretch.

Only people who unconditionally hate change defend the old morde.

Except for the W thing.  Morde just needs to be able to use his W in solo lanes.  That's the main thing holding him back.

This rework is hated for how much Morde's playstyle is toxic. Like, literally, it is feast or famine: if you destroy your enemy laner and get fed, you become an unstoppable killing monster because of those stupidly high Q ratios. If you get behind on lane, you become practically useless. You either are unstoppable or useless without any chances for come back. That's why this rework is hated so much.

Worse fucking rework ever.

They took him away from tops/mids that actually play him to shove him bot.

They boosted his scalling, which was fine, while lowering his fall back patterns with things like using W to farm minions and get a bit more tanky. Thus making him extremely feast and famine.
if you hate the rework for that, then you're stupid, morde has always been feast or famine.

I thought the point of a rework was to fix and improve a champion, to be healthier, not double down on the worst part of it.

Really, this is an experiment by Riot to make a melee carry. The problem is they took a champion that almost never plays that lane and against the advice of the entire Morde player base, gutted his primary lane so he **couldn't** play any other lane than bot.

Honestly, once Riot is done with their little experiment and gets all the data for their next champion, they should release the real Morde remake.
Honestly, I wouldn't be surprised if they did just that.
I've played both, old Morde was safer and easier to use but new Morde does more single target damage, and the Dragon really helps take towers against teams that can clear your wave quickly.
The dragon is great... If you're playing on the rift...
champions aren't balanced for non rift play, you should already know this.

still should have something to offset the dragon gimmick on other maps, especially since mords Bonus Xp passive doesn't work on at least aram (haven't tested Dominion or TT), I'm assuming because everyone receives full Xp from minion kills on that map (otherwise he would be lvl 6-7 by the time the rest of the team hits lvl 4). You're right,  they're not balanced for non rift play, but they do make adjustments. Like when they nerfed healing in aram cause it was (and still is to some degree) so oppressive.
The truth has been spoken

That's the whole point. 

CertainlyT injected Morde's Q with so much steroids that all his other abilities withered away.

Which goes back to how Morde rework didn't fix shit about Morde's power curve, but it did succeed in nerfing solo Morde heavily while Riot hands out a batch of compensation in order for Morde to play in a Duo lane.

... If you haven't noticed, PBE is for bugtesting. Any balance changes are either in Riot's internal testing (where they KNOW everyone's qualified) or on Live (Where there is enough Data to actually draw conclusions). PBE is a bad statistical place to look for balance info- too small of a sample size in addition to being (majorly) one region's players (and not the most innovative region either). In addition, PBE is used for all the changes at once, so (from experience) everyone tries out the new things, so there isn't a good point of stability that is tested against- you end up with 4Jugg teams duking it out, and they seem pretty evenly matched. But there are very few games that play out like a regular game, one juggernaut (maybe) on a team- and thus very few games that actually show a reasonable situation that could be balanced towards/from.

tl;dr: I'm not even certified and I can tell that PBE isn't good for balance changes.

As someone who carried game after game as solo lane Morde before the rework, this is the terrible reasoning that Riot used to justify this train wreck of a rework.  And it's complete garbage.  Morde felt completely viable in lane pre-rework, **CT** of all people declared his solo laning toxic (he's currently about pre-rework Darius kind of obnoxious if you're in a decent matchup, he was a little better before), and he has more problems than ever.  The cherry on top is his absolutely ludicrous burst, and I feel terrible for any opponents I face who don't know the new Morde well because they keep trying to fight me when my Q is up.  In melee range.  I get kills of those situations on opponents who are full health when I'm at half.

And this is about his solo lane, not his bot lane.  His bot lane is starting to appear too strong (probably because of the aforementioned burst for one thing), but his solo lane is considered quite weak.

He was very viable before the rework in solo lane. I used to use him top and as a backup mid. He was the epitome of rape minion wave, get slight level advantage, and steamroll the enemy under their turret, then kill them under turret when you get bored. I wouldnt even dream of taking him solo lane right now, and thats sad. They really could buff his w just a bit to allow it solo, maybe make it so it only goes where you cast unless you cast it on another champ, in which case you both get it. That way he can toss it on a minion to gain shield before going in for last hits, or he can toss it on himself and wade in for a bit of heal. It wouldnt be overpowerd and i really agree with everyone that said having it only work with another champ / ghost is extremely toxic to his solo laning. It can be lolsy going "adc" and wrecking the other team with the early advantage, but he loses out on seiging power too much to make it worth. His seiges happen every time drags up and that makes it easy to counter him.
